quizzes.question: What does implementing an interface mean in Java?
quizzes.answer: A class agrees to follow the rules of that interface
distractors: Inheriting the methods and properties of the base class
Extending a class from an existing one
Creating an object-oriented programming language
A class agrees to follow the rules of that interface

quizzes.question: What keyword is used to create or extend an interface in Java?
distractors: Implements
Extends
Creates
Instantiate

quizzes.question: What is the main difference between an abstract class and interfaces?
quizzes.answer: Abstract classes can define constructors and instance variables.
distractors: Interfaces can define constructors and instance variables
Interfaces are best used to couple a concrete class to a particular constructor
Abstract classes can define constructors and instance variables.
Abstract classes cannot define methods

quizzes.question: How is the keyword "extends" used in Java?
distractors: To extend a concrete class
To implement an interface or abstract class
To extend another interface
To create an abstract class

quizzes.question: What is the difference between implements and extends in Java?
quizzes.answer: Implements is used to implement an interface or abstract class, while extends is used to extend a concrete class.
distractors: Implements is used to extend a concrete class, while extends is used to implement an interface or abstract class.
Extends is used to implement an interface or abstract class, while implements is used to extend a concrete class.
Extends is used to create concrete subclasses, while implements is used to provide implementations for one or more interfaces.
Implements is used to implement an interface or abstract class, while extends is used to extend a concrete class.
